content:
Hi! The chapter on deriving handlers in the language reference mentions that DerivingHandlers can take on optional arguments passed after the with keyword, e.g. 

-- Here, `fooArgs` is passed as an argument to the deriving handler associated with `Foo`
deriving instance Foo with fooArgs for Bar, Baz

However, examining this PR, it seems like that passing arguments to deriving handlers is no longer supported.

I also looked at the source code of various existing handlers (e.g. deriving BEq) and it seems like none of them take in arguments via the with keyword.

I was wondering if this feature has been deprecated, and if so, whether the language reference has yet to be updated? Thanks!
Yeah, @David Thrane Christiansen removed this feature while he was writing this part of the manual.
Ernest Ng has marked this topic as resolved.
Seems I missed a docstring in the process - this PR fixes it. Thanks for pointing it out!
